Function.Description: The evalInSyncLocalContext function allows the user to evaluate the specified string expression in a temporary synchronous local context.

Brief.Overview: The evalInSyncLocalContext function allows the user to evaluate the specified string expression in a temporary synchronous local context.
Brief.Usage: The evalInSyncLocalContext function is used to evaluate a string expression in its own temporary context.

Argument.Name: size
Argument.Note: The number of megabytes used for the new context workspace

Argument.Name: evalString
Argument.Note: The Lisp string to be evaluated in the temporary context

Syntax.Return: If no argument is passed, the inspect function returns the number of free memory bytes remaining
